posts._title: Siu Ming Tsui – Bong ju AKA The Gang Master (1982)
posts.title: Bong ju
posts.excerpt: This is no street gang or gang of mobsters. It’s a Yuan Dynasty army, out to destroy the Hsien Lung “gang” of anti-Yuan revolutionaries. Their leader is the redoubtable Chen Kuan-tai, the real-life South-East Asian Chinese Martial Arts Tournament champion and master of “Monkey-King Split and Deflecting Arm” kung-fu, who must face paternal murder, brother …

posts.title: Spirala
posts.excerpt: In what appears to be an inexplicable incident, a man drives up to a resort hotel in midwinter, throws away his car keys, enters, and proceeds to agitate everyone he meets with his urgency — a message he is somehow unable to communicate. Then he leaves, disappearing in the snow. Later, the people he appeared …

posts._title: Aigars Grauba – Rigas sargi AKA Defenders of Riga (2007)
posts.title: Rigas sargi
posts.excerpt: The film dramatizes November 11, 1919- a crucial date in the battle for Latvian independence. A year after the end of the official hostilities of WWI, a renegade German general and troops remain outside the Latvian capital. Latvian riflemen, most of them inexperienced volunteers, somehow managed to defeat a larger, better-armed force of German and …

posts._title: Ahmed Badrakhan – Ahebbak inta AKA I Love You (1949)
posts.title: Ahebbak inta
posts.excerpt: Samia and Farid bump into each other by chance. Farid ends up renting a room in the house where Samia with her troop of dancers live. Their opposite characters clash while there’s also chemistry between them. Some misunderstandings drive the two away from each other. But events turn in their favour.

posts._title: Alain Resnais – Mon oncle d’Amérique AKA My American Uncle (1980)
posts.title: Mon oncle d’Amérique
posts.excerpt: Mon oncle d’Amérique (“My American Uncle”) is a 1980 French film directed by Alain Resnais. The film stars Gérard Depardieu, Nicole Garcia, and Roger Pierre. The didactic film is built around the ideas of French physician, writer and philosopher Henri Laborit, who plays himself in the film. It uses the stories of three people to …

posts.title: Sette orchidee macchiate di rosso
posts.excerpt: SYNOPSISUmberto Lenzi (Cannibal Ferox) directs this giallo, based on a novel by Edgar Wallace, about a killer who begins a series of brutal murders and leaves some bizarre clues that he plans to carry out seven ritualistic killings. posts._title: Maurice Dugowson – F comme Fairbanks AKA F as in Fairbanks (1976)
posts.title: F comme Fairbanks
posts.excerpt: Synopsis:André Fragman (baptised “Fairbanks” by his cinema projectionist father) returns from his military service with a diploma in chemistry. posts._title: Hisayasu Satô – Lolita vib-zeme AKA Lolita Vibrator Torture (1987)
posts.title: Lolita vib-zeme
posts.excerpt: Synopsis:A perverted social outcast lures young sailor-suited virgins to the back of his truck where he torments and murders them before disposing of their corpses in an acid bath. posts._title: Dario Argento – Il gatto a nove code AKA The Cat o’ Nine Tails AKA Cat o’ Nine Tails (1971)
posts.title: Il gatto a nove code
posts.excerpt: Synopsis:Franco Arno is a blind man that lives with his young niece and makes a living writing crossword puzzles. One night, while walking on the street, he overhears a weird conversation between two man sitting in a car parked in front of a medical institute where genetic experiments are performed. posts._title: Krzysztof Zanussi & Henryk Ryszka – Samolot z Budapesztu AKA A Plane from Budapest (1961)
posts.title: Samolot z Budapesztu
posts.excerpt: An early Zanussi short. Fun fact: it’s called “Plane from Budapest” but the only arriving plane in the movie is from Amsterdam.Quote:Here we see short scenes from a random day at the airport. We have flying planes, landings, passport checking scenes, passengers waiting for their relatives. This documentary shows the ordinary but unique behaviors and …
